for-redhat: OnionShare for Red Hat, Fedora, etc.
verify-desc1: When you download OnionShare from this website you're downloading over HTTPS, but it's still possible that an attacker with access to a browser-trusted certificate authority (such as a government) could perform a man-in-the-middle attack against you, swapping out the file you thought you downloaded with malware.
verify-desc2: To be completely sure that the download was not tampered with, you can verify the cryptographic PGP signature of the file you downloaded.
verify-desc3: All OnionShare releases are digitally signed by this PGP key with fingerprint: 0B14 9192 9806 5962 5470 0155 FD72 0AD9 EBA3 4B1C.
verify-desc4: Detailed instructions for how to verify the authenticity of your downloads for all operating systems are coming.
disclaimer: Like all software, OnionShare may contain bugs or vulnerabilities. Because it is still in early stages of development, caution is recommended before using OnionShare in high-risk environments. Ultimately, everyone uses OnionShare at their own risk.
footer: OnionShare was developed by Micah Lee and is open source, released under the GPLv3. You can find the code for this website on GitHub as well.
slogan: OnionShare is an open source tool that lets you securely and anonymously share a file of any size. Read more about how it works and how to use it on it's GitHub page.
bugs-desc: Found a bug in OnionShare? Check the issues page to see if it's already been reported, or open a new issue here.
tails: To install in your Tails persistent volume, follow these instructions.
